document_title: High liver enzymes: Levels, complications and prevention
subsection_name: men-gan-cao.json_6_How to prevent high liver enzymes
subsection_content:
– Do not drink alcohol, or drink in moderation.
– Absolutely do not share needles or items contaminated with blood.
– Eat healthy, scientifically, increase the consumption of foods that are good for the liver.
– Fully vaccinated against hepatitis A and hepatitis B.
– If the patient has diabetes, they should manage blood sugar well.
– Use caution when using any medications or supplements you are taking.
– Monitor your weight and maintain it at a reasonable level.
– Exercise daily to improve overall health.
High liver enzymes have many different causes, including liver disease and medications. Increased liver enzymes in some cases may also be temporary. If your blood tests show high levels of liver enzymes, talk to your doctor to find the cause and treatment.
